review.title: Great Place for a Romantic Stay Vacation
review.reviewText: Took my girlfriend for a Saturday night stay-vacation for her birthday in the city and the St. Regis was an excellent place to stay. The staff was great and accommodating. The St. Regis restaurant Grill was fantastic. The morning breakfast in the Vitrine Restaurant was fabulous.

review.title: Top
review.reviewText: You cannot beat the quality of this hotel. The staff were beyond excellent.

review.title:
Very good hotel .large room
Good servic
review.reviewText:
Good wether .san francisco is beutifull
Good location.near market st.

review.title: Great Down Town Hotel
review.reviewText: The only downside was the lack of closet and draw space in the room. It is in a great shopping and exercise location
review.negativeRemarks: Room storage space. A little pricey but competitive for the location and service provided
review.locationRemarks: Market Street Shopping. Many good restaurant selections.

review.title: Weekend in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: We thought we'd try the recently renovated St Regis at the end of our cycling trip to Napa and Sonoma. Though only there for two nights, we couldn't have asked for a more luxurious spot. Arriving in jeans and looking quite disheveled after a morning ride, we were treated no differently than anyone else. Our check in was smooth, pleasant and our room was even ready early. We were even offered their private car service for dinner with friends the following evening. The pool is lovely and salt water. Breakfast is on the fourth floor, something we didn't find on our first morning because the information in the room directs you to the bar area in the lobby for coffee and continental breakfast. Loved the room decor. Simplistic and modern with all of the conveniences one would expect in a 5 star hotel.
review.positiveRemarks:
Decor was lovely. Very Zen!
Staff were excellent. Efficient and friendly without being in your space.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the hotel info in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Location isn't as central as some as its in the business district but if you're up to it everything is still within walking distance.

review.title: The best located Hotel, clean, nice staff.
review.reviewText: The best cappuccino... accommodating staff, got upgrade because it was our first stay... just a really really nice staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful pool overlooking San Francisco's business district, yet full of light... gorgeous!

review.title: The very best hotel in San Francisco, California
review.reviewText: Whether traveling or scheduling a special occasion event, this is the absolute best spot to stay in San Francisco. Elegant, luxurious and well appointed. Beautiful, serene and very clean accomadations. The staff are top-notch and take the very best care of you with exceptional service, considerations and prompt attention to any request. It was my husbands birthday and the hotel staff was so gracious in taking the time to make sure we had an exceptional stay and it was. The spa and pool are also fabulous and a great way to refresh and renew, we look forward to returning as much as possible when traveling to the area. The best of SF❤️

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: I have been staying to this hotel twice so far. Looking forward to come back.

review.title: Excellent San Francisco Hotel, Stay, Location!
review.reviewText: We usually only stay at the St. Regis whenever we go to SF. We love it there. The rooms are amazing, the hotel staff is terrific and everything about the stay was perfect. For this trip, we only booked a regular room since we knew we'd be quite busy and not really in the room very much. We did ask when we checked in if there were any upgrades available. They gave us a 4-level upgrade to a "Metropolitan Suite". OMG, the room was fabulous, the butler service was amazing, the private dining was fantastic. Can't say anything but wonderful things about this stay.
review.positiveRemarks: I think the experience speaks for itself above.
review.locationRemarks: St. Regis is located just outside of Union Square, so it is central and easy walking access all around the financial district.

review.title: Nice hotel close to St.Patrick's church & Bart sta
review.reviewText: Hotel employees are so helpful especially Kathline & Mariah @ the concierge

review.title: 4 star hotel. Good location
review.reviewText: Our room was near a service area and quite noisy. The closet was very small. The bathroom was small-towels & rug in bathroom were frayed. The room definitely needs some updates. I just expected more at the rate of $700 plus a night. Usually stay at 4 Seasons. In my opinion there is no comparison.

review.title: Just about perfect
review.reviewText: Great location, especially if you're at a convention or conference at Moscone. Hard to fault. Only beef would be the telephone system, which from an intuitive standpoint leaves much to be desired. Otherwise, an excellent choice.
nice but not worth it.  can get much better for this price and better perks.
review.negativeRemarks: hotel wifi should be complimentary for hotel with average room rate of over 500

review.title: Close to everything, lots to do.
review.reviewText: Outstanding will revisit in the future my daughter enjoyed the milk n cookies that was left in the room for her:)

review.title: Excellent Hotel in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The St. Regis met all of our expectations! The staff was consistently helpful and polite, the location is great for shopping and restaurants, and the house car was a great bonus to get to North Shore or Fishermans Warf for extra dinner options (tip: take the house car, which is a luxury auto, to dinner and then take Uber Black back to your hotel).  Overall, this was a first-class hotel!
Great hotel, nice staff, and great amenities. Enjoyed the massage!!!

review.title: Pricey, but an excellent stay
review.reviewText: Pricey hotels come with high expectations, but this one did not disappoint.  Stayed here for 3 days for a conference that was also held in the hotel, and it was a great stay overall.
review.negativeRemarks: If there's anything at all bad to say, it's that it is time to update the TVs in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is right around the corner from a movie complex and a bunch of restaurants, felt like a taste of San Fran for sure.

review.title: Fabulous hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Our stay at the St. Regis was better than expected. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom spacious. The hotel staff were professional and welcoming from the time we arrived to the time we left. The short walk to Union Square was great  and from there a cable car ride away from Fisherman's Wharf. I would recommend this hotel to everyone I know going to San Francisco for a visit.
review.positiveRemarks:
Friendliness and professionalism of the staff
Size of the rooms and bathrooms
review.negativeRemarks: Would have loved to have a coffeemaker in the room
review.locationRemarks:
Close enough walk to Union Square
Easy to access buses, cable cars and taxisDian

review.title: Excellent staff.  Clean room.  Good location.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed stay.  Cleanliness is number 1 priority and met expectations.

review.title: Amazing service
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived every person we came in contact with was wonderful they helped get a sitter order flowers book our massage and our tours of everything but the food from room service is what I can't get over so perfect if I could I'd live there
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was so kind said good morning every morning to our daughter by name and helped meet all our needs. You must try room service
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing I'd work on was we witnessed a incident with an intoxicated woman on the street in front of the hotel it was not handled well
review.locationRemarks: We started in Chinatown and a short walk to the pier loved the location because it's close to everything but away from the busy wharf

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: Good location, excelent Room, clean, have everything you need for a Perfect atay.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Wonderful. The entire staff was great with clean rooms too

review.title: Great location and wonderful hotel.
review.reviewText: Still recovering from the amazing food and wine in this town. Can't wait to visit again!

review.title: Terrific hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel ambience right from from the check in desk to the room are very relaxing and neat.
The staff were very polite and helpful. Room service also is commendable.

review.title: A GREAT stay in San Francisco!!!
review.reviewText:
This is a posh/splurge hotel.  Very high tech room.  The bathroom is an experience itself.  Awesome shower.  Great staff who are ultra professional but not the least bit snooty like some fancy hotels.
I cut myself and needed a bandage.  I swear someone was at my for with a BandAid in less than sixty seconds!

review.title: highly recommend the St Regis
review.reviewText: any discerning traveler will not be disappointed with the St Regis experience!
review.positiveRemarks:
staff was very helpful
actually got us tickets last minute to the Giants American league championship game!

review.title: Very Nice Hotel, great location.
review.reviewText:
Everything you would expect from a St Regis hotel.

Food at AME was very good and the bar menu had a steak sandwich on it that if it was a religion I would start praying to it.

Gym was a bit small but had everything you would need, pool is a good size and the spa had great service / attention to detail.
review.positiveRemarks: Great vibe for a large city hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: You have to remember that you are staying in a city.  I was on a high floor and the street noise could be heard very clearly.

review.title: Confortable hotel close to shopping & dining optio
review.reviewText: The St Regis is a comfortable hotel, centrally located with helpful staff.  I booked a Grand Deluxe room  - while comfortable it was not very spacious - I can only think if I had booked a regular or even a Delux room I'd have been disappointed with the room.  The room furnishings were plush and comfortable though a little bland in terms of colour/decor.  I had a treatment in the spa - it was excellent and the facilities were great.  Top marks there.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, great spa and swimming pool, comfortable room
review.locationRemarks: Close to union square shopping and dining, accessible to key tourist locations - i.e. Golden Gate bridge etc

review.title: St. Regis San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great property. Well located. Will definitely stay there again. Overnight parking was quite a shock ($61 including taxes), but other than that, very pleased with the stay.

review.title: Top notch
review.reviewText: Only complaint is lack of closet/storage space. Great location, staff goes above and beyond expectations to please the guests. If you don't mind paying for first class, this is your place.

review.title: Good, not GREAT
review.reviewText:
The hotel is VERY nice, don´t get me wrong. But some of the staff had a bit of an attitude, specially at the restaurant in the second floor, which we visited for breakfast. Slow service, not so good food.
The rooms are very nice, modern clean look. Everything was very clean. Nice tech in the rooms, touch screens, etc. They have a Bentley that takes you complimentary if you are going somewhere near. The location is fine, a 5 min walk to Union Square.

review.title: They actually hate your dog
review.reviewText: the staff was nice and said hello and opened doors and was quite pleasant. I had stayed here before, while on tour with a band and we had an off day and stayed at this hotel. When it came time to take a personal vacation, I saw no other option after a first good experience. They also took dogs, so I was ecstatic. Half way through my stay, I was asked if there were problems with my dog, as it was "barking excessively" which was complete BS. My dog only barked if kids ran down the hallway, slammed their doors or if drunk mid 40 year olds pretending to be 21 again, were throwing their high heels down the hall and acting like children, then yes, he barked. But it was ok, for other guests to act like animals. I was asked why my dog was barking so excessively, which again, he wasn't. and I stated the said reasons. She said that I could no longer leave my room without my dog. In which I replied well, I can't bring my dog to the bridge, to alcatraz and basically named off every single attraction in the San Fran region. She said, that I had to hire a pet sitter, at like 50 bucks an hour or some ridiculous garbage. I was basically forced to keep my dog in the car, or just not go anywhere. But yet, guests were still acting like children and weren't being punished. Kids were running down the hallway screaming at 6:45 in the morning and thats how I woke up every day. Instead of refunding us or helping us, she offered a refund and to find me somewhere else to say. Place is a joke.
review.positiveRemarks: Views, shower, friendlyness and cleanliness and security
review.negativeRemarks: Management and how contradicting and not understanding they were
review.locationRemarks: Right on the corner, awesome views

review.title: St Regis
review.reviewText: Great experience except the door to mini bar had a light that would not turn off had to rig it to close they told me to call in am

review.title: great hotel if you dont care about the value you a
review.reviewText:
all good.
nice fitness center
decent location
only complaint....too pricey for what you get.
four seasons and others better.

review.title: Good yoga room and excellent location.
review.reviewText:
The only problem was a noisy LCD panel to control the room electronics.

They mentioned that is about to be changed in all rooms.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Everyone went out of there way to make your stay enjoyable. I wish we were able to stay longer and take in all the amenities. Just to much to do in San Francisco to spend a lot of time in the hotel. Would not hesitate at all to recommend this hotel outstanding customer service and great location.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Location and very good customer service
review.locationRemarks: Very centrality located. Easy access to shopping and Art museums. Very close to the financial districtwith easy access to Little Italy and China Town.

review.title: GREATT
review.reviewText: amazing, everything and more that I could ask for from a hotel. Had no Idea where to eat or what to do and with the friendly concierge staff they made everything possible. also the hotel car is not a bad way to travel.

review.title: San Fran. visit
review.reviewText: Hotel was tough to get to due to the traffic. But once you are there it is a gorgeous hotel. We had the deluxe rooms and they did not disappoint. Very clean room and very professional staff. I definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: fantastic
review.reviewText: great service, beautiful hotel

review.title: Best hotel I've stayed in.
review.reviewText: This service, comfort and location of this hotel was the best. St. Regis will be my number one choice when I am back in SF.

review.title: Opulent modern in SF
review.reviewText: A lovely suite, beautiful hotel and attractive neighborhood right next door to SF MOMA and across the street from a lovely, tranquil urban park. Modern art everywhere in the hotel. Room decor is also modern and could have been a bit warmer but all in all a lovely room with a great bath and a city scape view of about 150 degrees by virtue of corner location. Ame Restaurant is wonderful with its seafood and Asian flavored menu and great service. Expensive but worth it. About 5 blocks from Union Square. Spoil yourself.

review.title: very good experience
review.reviewText: We had a nice exprience at the St. Regis SF. This was our second time at the hotel. Modern hotel with good service. Took advantage of the beautiful spa and the work-out room. We loved the bar on the 1st floor. Sean the bartender was amazing! Good location for shopping and for the MOMA and conventions. It was only about a mile to the ferry building.

review.title: Not what I expected from the Regis!
review.reviewText: The hotel atmosphere was super cold including the staff and decoration. My room had the worst view. Close to the spa and I can hear the doors and the ring of the elevator. Not the best location you have to walk for a while to get to union square or embarcadero. I asked for an upgrade for my anniversary but although the hotel was empty they wanted to charge me extra! The valet takes long! Not what I expected from the Regis.

review.title: Favorite San Francisco hotel so far
review.reviewText: Excellent service. Excellent rooms. Food a little pricey even by San Francisco standards. Would recommend to a friend.

review.title: Awsome
review.reviewText: Unbelievable service, very clean, extremely comfortable hotel. Everything you would need, great neighborhood, close to China town and Little Italy (awsome food) The hotel helped to make our San Francisco experience great.

review.title: Heaven in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The St. Regis was incredible, everything I expected it to be. The people were very helpful and delightful in every way. It is very pricey in general, but if you're looking for the best in every way, it is the perfect place to spend a special time or event. We were very pleased with our stay there.

review.title: The "Perfect" Hotel
review.reviewText:
My husband and I decided to go to San Francisco to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and wanted a really special place to stay. This is our first trip to this fabulous city and we were unsure where to stay. The St Regis Hotel made our trip perfect. The location is great and the hotel is beautiful, but
what made this hotel outstanding is the staff. Everyone was friendly, helpful, and efficient. The concierge staff was unbeatable. On several occasions, they went above and beyond our expectations to make our trip memorable. We have never been treated so well at any other hotel. The staff actuallly greeted us by name! . In addition, the bathrooms are fabulous. The bathtub is deep and spacious and the shower is large enough for two. The makeup mirror is also an nice touch. The St. Regis is a five star (make that a ten star) hotel that I recommend hightly. We can't wait to go back!

review.title: Excellent hotel in great location
review.reviewText: The St Regis is a great hotel. From check-in to departure, service was impeccable. The room (Grand Deluxe) was bright and airy with beautiful amenities. The location is great too, right beside Union Square for those who need a shopping fix. The F line tram down to the Ferry Building and Fisherman's Wharf is only a couple of minutes walk away so access to all the tourist attractions is easy. There are plenty of coffee shops and diners around to get breakfast but an early mornng coffee can be got on the 4th floor of the hotel for no charge. The concierge was fantastic in recommending great places to eat and making the reservations too. Use of the free hotel car is on a first come first served basis but we were able to avail of it most evenings which took the hassle out of trying to find our way to our restaurant. All in, we had a fantastic time and would recommend it to anyone visiting San Francisco.

review.title: A St. Regis Experience
review.reviewText: I found the staff and hotel accommodations superb. The location is excellent and near several museums. The rooms and ambiance of the hotel made my stay very relaxing and comfortable. The room and bath facilities were cozy and had all the preferred features and the spa, pool and gym facilities were excellent. I was impressed by the responsiveness of the staff and in general of all the amenities the hotel had to offer. Would highly recommend this hotel and is my preferred hotel of stay while in San Francisco.

review.title: A year ago
review.reviewText: A year ago we were coming out of the SFMOMA, full of shopping bags, and a gentleman from the St. Regis, offered to hail a cab for us. We told him we were not guests at the hotel, but he just smiled, and proceeded to get us a cab. I was intrigued. This year, after our conference at another hotel was over, we stayed three luxurious nights at the St. Regis, and everybody was just as friendly, helpful and welcoming as the gentleman who hailed a cab for us the year prior. We are coming back next year.

review.title: It exceeded my every expectation.
review.reviewText: The St. Regis is everything a hotel should be and more. It is beautiful, beautifully maintained, and well-located. The hotel staff went out of their way not only to address but to anticipate my every need. Fantastic!!

review.title: St. Regis is worth it!
review.reviewText: Our room was better than advertised with amenities not detailed in their websites description. The service from every staff member we interacted with was outstanding. Definitely consider staying here if your a looking for a luxurious experience!

review.title: The Best
review.reviewText: One of the best places I have stayed in, excellent large rooms with exceptional service.

review.title: Fantastic stay, well worth it
review.reviewText: I stay in 8-10 hotels a year for pleasure and this is right near the top of my list of favorites. The location is great, the staff is very helpful, and the amenities are on par with other spots in SF. There is a house Bentley too, if dinner is close by have them give you a ride...

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: When my husband and I were checking in, the woman at the front desk asked us where we were from (we are somewhat local) and we mentioned that it was our wedding anniversary. Shortly after checking in we received champagne and truffles with a note of congratulations, which I thought was a very nice touch. As other people had mentioned, our control panel for the room was not working and someone from Engineering had to come fix it, it was then I was told that you could control everything manually too, which would have been fine. Another point that keeps coming up is the fact that it was noisy. I didn't notice ANY hotel noise whatsoever, however there were a lot of fire engine sounds coming from the street, but I've spent a lot of time in San Francisco and NYC and I just feel like it's part of staying in the city, it didn't bother me at all. Overall our stay was excellent and I would stay there again.

review.title: georgeous!
review.reviewText: the room ,view, staff were excellent. great soaking tub the only minor complaint is they were a little skint with the amenities i had to ring for a shower cap and there were no bath salts over all very happy and would definitely recommend

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: We had an amazing stay at the St Regis, the staff were all friendly and attentive and the room was very comfortable and beautifully maintained.

review.title: So cool
review.reviewText: It was so excellent that I would recommend this hotel to travelers who loves upper accommodations . The room is highly sophisticated , stylishly minimal and cozily modern . I also enjoyed staying in because its location .

review.title: Impressive modern San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: The complementary personal butler was a nice touch to our stay. The rooms are very modern complemented with great wall & floor finishes. The touch screen panel is really cutting edge technology which controls the lighting, drapes, climate as well as accessing hotel services & amenities. Highly recommend this hotel to leisure & business travelers.

review.title: Top notch hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed for 7 nights and had only pleasant experiences with the people who work there. Service was prompt and courteous. Our room was great - we had one of the most comfortable beds we've ever had in a hotel. The only negative is that the rooms do not have coffee makers.

review.title: We plan to visit San Francisco again soon.Hopefully there is room avaliable at the St Regis
review.reviewText: The Hotel is very classey. Everyone is so professional and nice.The bellmen look so good in there uniforms.The room was simply beautiful and romatic. I loved the way the bathroom is set up. The bed was great. Can't wait to return.

review.title: Great Room - Dysfunctional breakfast service
review.reviewText: Everything was fabulous EXCEPT the breakfast service. The wait staff was dysfunctional; waited more than 20 minutes on 2 consecutive days for any interaction with the wait staff. After complaining, the manager (?) took the wrong order. Really pathetic!!

review.title: Amazing!!! I've stayed at many 5 star hotels and this was at the top!
review.reviewText: Exceeded my expectations and if you are into hi-tech, it's the place to be. 15 minute walk to the Marketplace & AT&T Park. Location is perfect for galeries, shows and shopping. the entire staff was great and service with a smile!
